history.content:
The course schedule can be found under Course Calendar on the class website: https://ucb-ee106.github.io/106b-sp20site/

We do recommend though that students have at least some controls experience beforehand or are committed to learning it quickly on the job since this class does expect you to already know the basics and only briefly covers it in a review format. I would highly recommend either taking EE C128 (or another controls class) before 106b or take them concurrently. 

Note that no other controls course at Berkeley (even at the grad level) goes into frequency-based controls design to the degree that 128 does, so I'd recommend taking 128 anyways. That being said, many students choose to simply take 221A without a prior controls course. The controls in 106B is closest to the material in EE 222, but is taught less rigorously. Familiarity with PID and state space control as well as some controls intuition should be sufficient preparation.

The course schedule can be found under Course Calendar on the class website: https://ucb-ee106.github.io/106b-sp20site/

We do recommend though that students have at least some controls experience beforehand or are committed to learning it quickly on the job since this class does expect you to already know the basics and only briefly covers it in a review format. I would highly recommend either taking EE C128 (or another controls class) before 106b or take them concurrently.
Title. I want to know if this class covers enough control theory so that I may not have to take 128.
history.subject: What does c106b cover in terms of material?
